lead_paragraph: Zach Parise’s power-play goal with 8 minutes 57 seconds remaining snapped a tie and gave the United States a 6-4 victory over Germany in a qualifying-round game at the world championship in Halifax, Nova Scotia. The Americans scored three times in the opening 2:52 but still needed Parise’s second goal of the game to secure the victory.
